messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] When are you out of school???
messages.msgSnippet: So I guess we are always done with school, but never ... I think it sounds great! Another one that I get asked is, Doesn t homeschooling take a lot of your
messages.messageBody:
So I guess we are always done with school, but never
>done with learning, but that just doesn't sound right.

I think it sounds great!

Another one that I get asked is, "Doesn't homeschooling take a lot of your
time?"

My answer is that it takes none of my time and all of my time. I explain
that I don't do school, so I don't spend any time *teaching*, but that I'm
always on duty to explain things and seek out things my son might be
interested in.
Tia

"Just as eating against one's will is injurious to health, so study without
a liking for it spoils the memory, and it retains nothing it takes in."
------Leonardo Da Vinci

Tia Leschke leschke@...
On Vancouver Island
______________________________________________
Canadian Homeschool Resource Page
http://www.flora.org/homeschool-ca

messages.subject: When are you out of school???
messages.msgSnippet: I have a question.  How do you and your kids respond to the question, So when are you done with school?  This is our first year of homeschooling and halfway
messages.messageBody:
I have a question. How do you and your kids respond to the question, "So when are
you done with school?" This is our first year of homeschooling and halfway through
we switched to unschooling. So I guess we are always done with school, but never
done with learning, but that just doesn't sound right.

What do you say?

Tarla in NC
Tarla
Homeschooling two in N.C.
